channel.title: Day off work excuses
channel.description:
Right. I need a day off of work this Sunday, and I'm looking for excuses to call in on the Thursday to say I can't work on the Sunday. I usually work every other Sunday, but i've done a month straight so far, and really need a day off + I got things to do, people to see etc.
Excuses I can call up in advance with will be ++

item.title: Day off work excuses
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

maniown:

You have a family emergence tell them you don’t want to get into details.

Yeah I got fired from this one… They said I was unreliable even though I called in sick twice in 6 months.

Read full topic

item.title: Day off work excuses
item.dc:creator: @Squigglyo Squigglyo
item.description:
@Squigglyo wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:29, topic:250574”][quote author=skiller noob1 link=topic=330476.msg2588646#msg2588646 date=1229642114]
Say your dick got stuck in the window.
[/quote]
Toilet seat > window.[/quote]

I tried… my boss asked for pictures or it didnt happen.

i showed him the pictures, i got the day off.

This works.

Read full topic

item.title: Day off work excuses
item.dc:creator: @Squigglyo Squigglyo
item.description:
@Squigglyo wrote:

i called in sick to work 10 mins before my shit one day.

Reason being, i was out getting drunk the night before with a mate… problem was, that mate had to cover my shift and got pissy and told the bosses.

i got fired the next day. Good times

Read full topic

item.title: Day off work excuses
item.dc:creator: @PeterMan PeterMan
item.description:
@PeterMan wrote:

[quote=“Mr.Chris, post:25, topic:250574”][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=330476.msg2583561#msg2583561 date=1229366848]
Is your boss a dictator or something? Is it too much to ask nowadays if you want a Sunday off? Just call your prick of a boss and say you want the fucking day of and if he doesn’t like it he can look for someone else.

Of course, if you have a really low job you shouldn’t go banana on him.
[/quote]

It’s not that, it’s just he’ll probably ask why…

Anyway, luckily he came online on the PS3 today, so I didn’t even have to call :)[/quote]
You got the coolest boss ever…

Read full topic

item.title: Day off work excuses
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

Mr.Chris:

Thanks for all the excuses. I think ill use the ‘aunt is a bit sick so want to see her before christmas’ excuse.

Won’t they wonder why go on a work day rather than in your own free time. Someone being sick is not an appointment, a funeral is ;). Just pick an already dead relative and say that you are going to their funeral if you don’t feel comfortable saying your alive nan is dead.

Read full topic

item.title: Day off work excuses
item.dc:creator: @Tree Tree
item.description:
@Tree wrote:

[quote=“Tico135, post:4, topic:250574”][quote author=goatee link=topic=330476.msg2581946#msg2581946 date=1229289522]
Nan died, funeral.
[/quote]

Likely his Nan has died 6 or 7 times already, haha.[/quote]

That’s why you claim she has a disease. It allows for multiple days off. A person can only die once.

Read full topic

[quote=“RXVL, post:15, topic:250574”][quote author=Frell link=topic=330476.msg2582179#msg2582179 date=1229296266]
Your ant is planning a divorce and you need to go pick up your cousin since the parents are having hard times. She lives 1 1/2 hours away.
[/quote]

aunt…

item.title: Day off work excuses

item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

Wow! I didn’t know ants could get married!

Call in and say your 15 year old step-brother has cancer, and you need to drive him to chemotherapy because both his parents have work.

item.dc:creator: @_Worx `Worx
item.description:
@_Worx wrote:

Hmm…Perhaps say you were visiting a sick relative, not a dying relative. Like something as simple as a parent who came down with a minor case of the flu or whatever sickness/illness you see fit to think up

item.description:

Great, but it all comes down to what the ‘some matter’ is.

item.title: Day off work excuses
item.dc:creator: @_Worx `Worx
item.description:
@_Worx wrote:

[quote=“Mr.Chris, post:10, topic:250574”]Saying I’m sick means I have to call up on the day, which I definitely wont be able to do. I could say personal family emergency, but I don’t really wanna say a relative died, just not right. + Qs may be asked about it later.

I’ll be able to work the day after, so I will offer to work then + no1 will be able to fill in for me.[/quote]

What about the one i proposed for saying you had to run out of town on some matter?

Read full topic

I’ll be able to work the day after, so I will offer to work then + no1 will be able to fill in for me.

item.description:

Tell the truth or ask someone if they can work for you that day, then you can work for her/him one day he/she wants free from work.
[/quote]

Of course who would be willing to do that[/quote]
I don’t say Mr.Chris earn money by get someone to work for him, he pays them, or he work for the person an other day.
